title: Monster Hunter 2 Wiki | Weapons
description: Easily view and navigate the complex weapon trees of Japanese versions of Monster Hunter and Monster Hunter G.
head: <link rel='stylesheet' href='../css/weapons.css'/><link rel='stylesheet' href='css/weapons.css'/><script type='text/javascript' src='../js/toggle_full_details.js'></script></script><script type='text/javascript' src='../js/weapons_common.js'></script><script type='text/javascript' src='js/weapon_data.js'></script><script type='text/javascript' src='js/weapons.js'></script>
subtitle: Names adjusted based on best guesses from the Gamefaqs MH1 weapon trees and MHF1 wiki weapons pages. Some weapons may not be obtainable through normal play. Most prices are for forging; a price in parentheses is the cost to buy.

greatSword.name: Charged Chop Lv1
inputs: R Stick Down (release after one chime)

greatSword.name: Charged Chop Lv2
inputs: R Stick Down (release after two chimes)

greatSword.name: Charged Chop Lv3
inputs: R Stick Down (release after three chimes)

hammer.name: Spin 1
inputs: R1 (full charge while moving, first hit)

hammer.name: Spin 2
inputs: R1 (full charge while moving, hits 2 through 6)

hammer.name: Golf Swing Finisher
inputs: R Stick (during third or fourth spin)

gunlance.name: Final Thrust
input: R Stick Up (after second Level Thrust)
R Stick Left (after second Level Thrust)
R Stick Right (after second Level Thrust)

gunlance.name: Upward Thrust
input: R Stick Up (while blocking or after Upswing)
R Stick Left (while blocking or after Upswing)
R Stick Right (while blocking or after Upswing)

dualSwords.name: Demon Rolling Slice
inputs: R Stick (after dodge rolling, demon mode)
